nodes.text: It's official: Kansas is now the latest state to ban govt. recognition of gay marriage.  http://www.cnn.com/2005/POLITICS/04/06/kansas.gaymarriage.ap/index.html I disagree with this one though. They worded it in such a way to prevent the state from recognizing civil unions for gay couples. I think they should have left that in.

Don't you think any gay person posting here already knew that? Do you think this comes as any surprise? I mean really! Kansas???? emoticon_rolleyes  I also understand Conneticutt is ready to pass legislation approving civil unions for same-sex couples without court intervention.
Default Conflict
I disagree with this one though. They worded it in such a way to prevent the state from recognizing civil unions for gay couples. I think they should have left that in.
Well, then you disagree with almost all the state amendments. You must be out of step with your party...
Default Conflict
Is the glass half empty or half full?? We are wining rights in some states and losing in others. Soon we will be a country divided, oh wait...we already are.
Default Conflict
I also understand Conneticutt is ready to pass legislation approving civil unions for same-sex couples without court intervention.
I think they should, and I hope it passes. I have no problem with civil unions for gay couples, and Kansas should have allowed it too.
Default Inference
So you don't support Connecticut passing a civil union law?

It's a flawed step in the right direction.  I support it compared to nothing. I did not support it when they were considering CUs vs. full marriage. They took the politically expedient way out. Lest you leap to any unwarranted conclusions, my main objection is the blatent inequality inhererent in CUs.
Default Conflict

Why can't you answer questions directly? anyway, I support ct in passing civil unions or marriage lite as I like to see it, but It doesn't confer equality. If it is really equ8al than it would be marrige. Reason beinbg portablity ( irealize you think that some day we might have that, but we don't so far and we cannot ccontrol other countries who may have gay marriage but not cilvil unions and may not recognize civil unions but recognize marriage.)  If it is good for straight couples, it should be equally good for all couples. . No one is more superior. Everyone should be equal. Marriage for all is equals.
Default Conflict

. . . and tell the posters there how disgusting and sinful they are and how their rights should be denied, repeatedly refuse to justify my condemnation of them with logic, indulge in ad hominem attacks on them when they challenge me to explain my motives, and get all huffy when they refuse to respect my posts.

Well, there you go. The fact he, in his reverse analogy, portrays mere disagreement in many cases as telling 'posters there how disgusting and sinful they are and how their rights should be denied' only makes my point. No once do I recall seeing anyone here saying that he or anyone else was 'disgusting,' and 'sinful.' Apparently he's not too familiar with the concept of ad hominem either.
Default Inference
Are you sure about that? Do you know who mai'ana is?
Default Conflict
You're right, I think he has made such comments. Sorry. I think he's wrong and went too far.
Default Conflict
